title: How to fix the chipping paint or coating on a Asus laptop touchpad - Quora

response.answer_text: I would look at forums and contact Asus about this. You might be able to put a sealer on to keep it from going worse. An external trackpad or mouse might be needed to preserve the trackpad so it'll work when you really need it. Working with a mechanic and other industrial clients where my trackpads plastic wore down due to grit at the clients. The top layer is so thin you can almost see through it.

You don't fix it but live with it. If you scratch it more, you end up in a useless touchpad. Worse still, a faulty touchpad affects the wireless mouse. You can live without cosmetics but if you cut your face, you… Buy a wireless mouse perhaps.
